comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I see there's also a Millicent, Duchess of Sutherland. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=950CE4D71638E633A... She married in October, 1914. Could this be her?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Looked at that, but Millicent was born in 1867, so she would have been 47 in 1914 (for her second marriage).  This looks more like a woman in her early 20s, as Eileen Sutherland-Leveson-Gower would have been that year.  (Millicent would have been Eileen's mother-in-law--Eileen married Millicent's son, the 5th Duke of Sutherland.)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Unless it's an older portrait than the 1914 part of the collection, which was sometimes the case with Bain portraits. By the way, there is a famous and beautiful 1904 John Singer Sargent painting of Duchess Millicent (which she sold when short of funds in the early 20's: jssgallery.org/Paintings/Millicent_Duchess_of_Sutherland.htm She and her 4 sisters were described as "all famous beauties" in her mother's obituary in 1933.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I agree that this is probably Eileen, See www.clanmacfarlanegenealogy.info/genealogy/TNGWebsite/sho... for a picture of Eileen in 1912, when she married the Marquis of Stafford, who became the 5th Duke of Sutherland in 1913 on the death of his father. But MIllicent was certainly a beauty. www.prints-online.com/r2/tatler_cover_duchess_of_sutherla... shows her on the front page of the Tatler in 1901.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Agreed!  They were both quite beautiful.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Yeah, no doubt it's Eileen.  The more I read about this family, the more Downton Abbey looks like a reality show. Millicent's daughter was ruled out as a match for one of the King's sons due to her mother's divorce and other activities.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for determining the proper duchess. We'll add some of the information for Eileen to the record the next time we update.
